document_data.caption: A map showing Noanar's Hold in the High Forest.
document_data.name: Noanar's Hold
document_data.mainbody: '''Noanar's Hold''' was a village, just off the [[Evermoor Way]] just on the edge of the [[High Forest]], that grew up around one of the most famous hunting lodges in the [[North]]. Cottages and well-kept stables rambled between the trees.
document_data.Government:
The Hunt Lords ruled the settlement and arranged hunting parties for rich sportsmen of the [[Sword Coast]].

Eventually, less and less people came, as rumors got out that the Hunt Lords encouraged their guests to kill one another. In their old age, the Hunt lords struck a deal with [[Orcus]], who transformed them into [[wight]]s, and their long-dead steeds into [[warhorse]] [[skeleton]]s.
document_data.History: Noanar's Hold was named after a famous hunter who once lived in the village keep.
document_data.Rumors and Legends: The village's hunts could involve anything from pursuing normal creatures to sentient beasts and humanoids that were less than willing participants.
document_data.Notable Inhabitants:
* The [[Hunt Lords]], five mysterious beings who use magic to conceal their identities
* [[Ghille Cever]] ([[White Hart Inn (Noanar's Hold)|White Hart Inn]]'s Owner)
* [[Markab Woodfoot]] (Head Huntsman of the Keep)
* [[Amrath Mulnobar]] (Castellan of the Keep and chief lawkeeper of the town)
document_data.Notable Locations: The [[White Hart Inn (Noanar's Hold)|White Hart Inn]] was the best inn in town and was run by [[Ghille Cever]],
document_data.Trivia: [[Noanar]] was also the name of a [[Netheril|Netherese]] [[arcanist]] famous for his [[fire]] magic.<ref>
